items.q: What documents can be verified?
items.a: Folio supports passports, national ID cards, driver licenses and residence permits from over 200 countries and regions.

items.q: How long does verification take?
items.a: Most verifications complete in under 10 seconds. Complex cases that require manual review may take longer.

items.q: How does Folio detect fraudulent documents?
items.a: Folio uses AI-powered checks to detect alterations, tampering, and forgeries. The system analyzes document structure, security features, fonts and metadata to spot inconsistencies.

items.q: Can I customize the verification flow?
items.a: Yes. You can define which documents to accept, set custom validation rules, configure automated decisions and add step-up verification when needed.

items.q: Is the verification process compliant with regulations?
items.a: Folio helps meet KYC and AML requirements across jurisdictions. The platform provides audit trails and detailed verification reports for compliance purposes.

items.q: What happens if a document cannot be verified automatically?
items.a: Cases that cannot be resolved automatically are flagged for manual review. Your team can examine the document and make a decision using the Review Workspace.

items.q: Does Folio support NFC chip reading?
items.a: Yes. For documents with NFC chips (like e-passports), Folio can read and verify the chip data for an extra layer of authenticity.

items.q: What is liveness detection?
items.a: Liveness detection confirms that the person in front of the camera is real and physically present. It prevents spoofing attempts using photos, videos, masks or deepfakes.

items.q: What types of attacks does liveness check prevent?
items.a: Folio detects presentation attacks (printed photos, screens, masks), injection attacks (manipulated camera feeds), deepfakes, synthetic faces and other AI-generated fraud attempts.

items.q: Is liveness detection certified?
items.a: Yes. Folio liveness detection meets the ISO/IEC 30107-3 standard for presentation attack detection, validated by a NIST-accredited testing laboratory.

items.q: How does passive liveness work?
items.a: Passive liveness analyzes multiple frames and visual signals without requiring the user to perform specific actions. This creates a smoother experience while maintaining strong security.

items.q: Does liveness detection work on all devices?
items.a: Yes. Folio is designed to perform consistently across different smartphones, operating systems, camera qualities and lighting conditions.

items.q: How fast is liveness verification?
items.a: Most liveness checks complete in under two seconds. Auto-capture and real-time guidance help users complete the process quickly.

items.q: Can liveness detection identify compromised devices?
items.a: Yes. Folio detects emulators, rooted or jailbroken devices and other unsafe environments that attackers use to inject manipulated images or videos.

items.q: How does face matching work?
items.a: Folio compares a live selfie with the photo on an ID document. Advanced AI models analyze facial features to confirm that the person presenting the document is the same person pictured on it.

items.q: How accurate is the face matching?
items.a: Folio achieves high accuracy rates validated by independent testing labs. The system is designed to minimize both false acceptances and false rejections while performing consistently across demographics.

items.q: Can face matching detect deepfakes and spoofing attempts?
items.a: Yes. Folio includes liveness detection that identifies presentation attacks, deepfakes, synthetic faces and injection attempts. Multiple frames are analyzed to ensure the selfie comes from a real person.

items.q: Is face matching biased toward certain demographics?
items.a: Folio uses models trained on responsibly sourced data and tested to show no material bias across age, sex or skin tone. Third party evaluations confirm fair performance across demographic groups.

items.q: How long does a face match check take?
items.a: Most face match checks complete in under two seconds. Auto-capture and real-time guidance help users take quality selfies quickly, minimizing delays.

items.q: What happens if the face match fails?
items.a: If the initial match is inconclusive, users can retry with better lighting or positioning. Persistent failures can be routed to manual review where your team examines the images.

items.q: Is selfie data stored securely?
items.a: You control how selfie data is collected, processed and stored. Folio supports data redaction, retention policies and compliance configurations to meet regulatory requirements in your regions.

items.q: What credential formats are supported?
items.a: Folio supports W3C Verifiable Credentials in JWT and JSON-LD formats, SD-JWT for selective disclosure, and ISO 18013-5 mDL format for mobile driver licenses. You can choose the format that best fits your use case and regulatory requirements.

items.q: How do I issue credentials via API?
items.a: Use our REST API to issue credentials programmatically. Define your credential schema, prepare the claims data, and make a POST request to the issuance endpoint. The API returns a signed credential that you can deliver to the user.

items.q: Can credentials be revoked?
items.a: Yes. You can revoke any credential at any time through the API or dashboard. Revocation takes effect immediately and verifiers can check revocation status in real time using standard protocols.

items.q: How are credentials delivered to users?
items.a: Credentials can be delivered via QR codes that users scan with their wallet app, deep links that open directly in the wallet, or push notifications for users who already have your app installed.

items.q: What standards does Folio follow?
items.a: Folio implements W3C Verifiable Credentials, W3C DID specifications, OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance (OpenID4VCI), and EUDI Wallet Architecture standards. This ensures interoperability with other compliant systems.

items.q: Can I customize credential schemas?
items.a: Yes. You can define custom schemas with the exact claims and data types your use case requires. You can also use standard schemas from schema.org or other registries for common credential types.

items.q: Is there batch issuance support?
items.a: Yes. The batch issuance API lets you issue thousands of credentials in a single request. This is useful for organizations issuing credentials to employees, students, or members at scale.
